strings.Value: "Stay. Together, we'll be able to protect Brineheart from any enemies to come."
"Where are you heading now?"
"Have a safe journey, Darven."
"Get lost. I don't want to see you ever again."
[Attack] "You're not going anywhere!"
"Aren't you afraid of Mammon's wrath?"
"I'll most certainly be taking you up on that invitation. And for now — farewell."
[Attack] "I don't need neighbors like you."
"So, you're no longer afraid of Mammon's wrath?"
"I'm glad that I helped your dream come true."
[Attack] "You are a criminal and a devil-worshipper. I cannot leave you alive. Accept your punishment with honor, if you can."

{n}Darven stands over Linxia's body in silence, an expression of deep contemplation frozen on his face. A few moments later, he's grinning and brushing his hair with his fingers.{/n} "You know, I've dreamt of this moment so many times, all my feelings seem burnt out."

"After so many years, my hunter is finally dead — and I stand over her dead body, making speeches full of pathos, melodramatic wisdom and self-praise. But you know what, she deserves none of it. She who lived so wickedly cannot die an honest death." {n}Darven turns calmly away from the dead Linxia, as if he's forgotten she ever existed at all.{/n}

"You made a deal with me, and remained true to your word to the end. In this regard, we are similar. I also keep my bargains by any means necessary. I've promised you a reward, and I shall keep my promise. This is all I have for now. Except for Brineheart, of course." {n}Darven winks playfully.{/n}

"You never promised to help me, and never offered me an alliance, yet still you came and helped me. It's difficult for me to understand you." {n}Darven looks at you with narrowed eyes, then sighs.{/n} "But any help must be repaid. Please, take this modest sum as a compensation for your efforts. Alas, I cannot offer more."

"First you strike a deal with me, then you betray me, and finally you help me again. I just can't understand you." {n}Darven looks at you with narrowed eyes, then sighs.{/n} "But any help must be repaid. Please, take this modest sum as a compensation for your efforts. Alas, I cannot offer more."

"And with that I shall bid you farewell. Unfortunately, I cannot establish Brineheart under such circumstances. Alas, my dream of having my own kingdom will have to remain but a dream — at least for the moment."

"With a neighbor like you I need not be afraid of {g|Hellknights}Hellknights{/g}. Besides, I wouldn't expect them to dare venture this way any time soon. Just give me a couple of days, and I'll fill this city with traders and merchants. And come back any time — don't be shy. You'll always be welcome in my city."

"Oh, you see..." {n}Darven speaks slowly, carefully choosing the words.{/n} "{g|Hellknights}Hellknights{/g} are extremely serious adversaries, and I could not dare to oppose them without a reliable ally. And you are... shall we say, a mystery to me. I cannot understand your motives, or predict the course of your actions. That is why I must thank you for your offer, but regretfully decline."
{n}Darven shrugs.{/n} "West. Or perhaps south. Somewhere warm, where the sea waves can lap at my feet. Perhaps I'll become captain of a pirate ship again... Who knows?"
"You take care too, {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen}. Maybe we shall meet again."
"Goodbye, {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}. Hope to see you soon!"
{n}Darven nods.{/n} "I will do as you command. Too bad we couldn't become friends."
"You saved me from Linxia only to kill me yourself? But… why?"

"The Archdevil is angry with me, this is true. I failed to build Brineheart in time, and thus incurred {g|Mammon}Mammon's{/g} wrath. Well... let's wish him luck in his search. Linxia's been chasing me for years, and only managed to catch up with me only because I stopped to wait for her. I'm even slightly curious — how would an Archdevil manage the task?"

"The Archdevil values contracts above all else. I managed to establish Brineheart before the deadline, and my city will become a stronghold of {g|Mammon}Mammon's{/g} faith. A small price to pay for all that power, wouldn't you say?"

"And you earned a decent sum of money while you did!" {n}Darven gives you an understanding smile.{/n} "But, if we're talking seriously, I'm thrilled to have my lifelong dream come true. And it makes me doubly happy to realize that it's you who will be my neighbor."
"If you ever decide to write a memoir, please send me a copy! It must be terribly interesting!"
